PAGE.TITLE: Integration by parts
PAGE.DESCRIPTION: Remember when solving the following problem that the method of integration by parts is derived by integrating the product rule rule and rearranging the resulting expression. We thus have: $$ \int u \frac{\textrm{d}v}{\textrm{d}x} \textrm{d}x = uv - \int v \frac{\textrm{d}u}{\textrm{d}x} \textrm{d}x $$ When using this method remember that you must divide the function you wish to integrate into a part $u$ and a part $\frac{\textrm{d}v}{\textrm{d}x}$. You then differentiate $u$ and integrate $\frac{\textrm{d}v}{\textrm{d}x}$ and insert what emerges into the equations above. Generally, when you pick the functions to use for $u$ and $\frac{\textrm{d}v}{\textrm{d}x}$ you want to choose functions so that $v \frac{\textrm{d}u}{\textrm{d}x} \textrm{d}x$ is a simpler function to integrate than the original $u \frac{\textrm{d}v}{\textrm{d}x} \textrm{d}x$.

EXERCISE.TITLE: Exercise 1
EXERCISE.PROBLEMS: Use integration by parts to find the following integrals: $$ \int x\sin(x) \textrm{d}x \qquad \int \frac{\ln(x)}{x^3} \textrm{d}x $$

EXERCISE.TITLE: Using integration by parts multiple times
EXERCISE.PROBLEMS: Solve the following definite integrals: $$ \int_0^\infty e^{-\lambda t } \textrm{d}t \qquad \int_0^\infty t e^{-\lambda t } \textrm{d}t \qquad \int_0^\infty t^2 e^{-\lambda t } \textrm{d}t \qquad \int_0^\infty t^3 e^{-\lambda t } \textrm{d}t \qquad $$
